isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Vibration Damper, Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel, and Crankcase - Remove - Flywheel or Flexplate

note.para: For applications using automatic transmissions, take note of the position and orientation of flexplate(s), spacers, and reinforcing ring.

step1.para: Remove two flywheel mounting bolts at 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Install two guide studs from Guide Stud Set (ZTSE4375) in place of mounting bolts.
Remove remaining ten flywheel mounting bolts.
Slide flywheel out of flywheel housing and off guide studs.

note.para: With flywheel removed, guide studs can be removed from crankshaft flange.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Flywheel - (148 Tooth Ring Gear) Manual Transmissions

note.para: With 148 Tooth Ring Gears (approximately 18.70" OD) Manual Transmissions

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, or possible death, do not remove any engine mount hardware until the engine is properly supported.

svcsubproc.para: Follow same procedure as Automatic Transmission flywheels, EXCEPT lower rear engine mount bolts on side of flywheel housing must be loosened. Must be done to provide clearance for removal and installation of flywheel ring gear.

caution.para: When installing 148 tooth ring gear (ring gear approximately 18.70" OD) flywheel, be sure to torque engine mount bolts to special torque after flywheel replacement.

note.para: Vehicles Equipped with Allison 2000 Series Automatic Transmissions

figure.caption: Remove flexplate (vehicles equipped with Allison 2000 series transmissions)

note.para: Note position and orientation of flexplate, spacers and reinforcing ring.

step1.para: Use paint marker to identify exposed face of reinforcing ring.
Remove two flexplate mounting bolts at 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Install guide studs from Guide Stud Set (ZTSE4375) in place of mounting bolts.
Remove remaining ten bolts from flexplate.
Slide reinforcing ring, flexplate and adapter hub, off guide studs. Guide studs may be removed after flexplate is removed.

note.para: Vehicles Equipped with MD-3000 Series Automatic Transmissions

figure.caption: Remove flexplate (vehicles equipped with MD-3000 series transmissions

caution.para: To avoid possible engine or vehicle damage, do not remove two small flexplate assembly bolts near the twelve flexplate mounting bolts. Alignment of flexplate assembly will be affected and will cause engine vibration and possible engine and transmission failure.

step1.para: Remove two flexplate mounting bolts at 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Install guide studs from Guide Stud Set (ZTSE4375) in place of mounting bolts.
Remove remaining ten bolts from flexplate.
DO NOT REMOVE flexplate assembly bolts.

note.para: Flexplate assembly is available as a complete service part. There is no need to disassemble flexplate assembly.

step1.para: Slide flexplate assembly off guide studs. Guide studs may be removed after flexplate assembly removal.
